title: Varanasi to Vindhyachal
intro: A pilgrim center in Mirzapur district of Uttar Pradesh located just 70km away from Varanasi,Vindhyachal is quite popular for its astonishing view and religious aspects. It is said that the goddess Sati herself dwells in Vindhya. This city witness the congregation of thousands of devotees during the Navratri. This city is majorly popular for the vindhyavasini temple located at the bank of the Ganga river. Other sacred places in the town include Ashtabhuja temple, Sita Kund, Kali Khoh, Narad Ghat, Gerua Talab, Kal Bhairav temple, and many more.

article.heading: Places to visit in Vindhyachal
paragraph: Maa Vindhyavasini Devi Temple: Dedicated to goddess Durga, Vindhyavasini temple is located 8 km from Mirzapur city at the bank of the Ganga river. It is said that goddess Vindhyavasini was the daughter of Yashoda born on the same night as Lord Krishna. When the evil Kansa tried killing the baby she left her grip miraculously and took the divine form of the goddess. This is one of the 51 Shakti peethas located in India. Outside the temple there are colorful shops on both sides and the main temple complex, though small, has many temples in it. It is believed that whosoever visits this temple gets their prayers answered.

Ashtabhuja Temple: The second of the trinity Devi temples in Vindhyachal, ashtabhuja temple is a hilltop shrine located 3 km from Vindhyavasini Temple. This temple is dedicated to the goddess Saraswati, usually known as the goddess of knowledge. It is believed that Ashtabhuja, the sister of Krishna, came here after relieving herself from the grip of demon Kansa, who wanted to kill her, just after her birth to Vasudeva and Devaki. At the mound where this shrine is located, there are three sacred ponds namely Sita Kund, Gerua Talab, and Motiya Talab.

Kali Khoh: Located just a few kilometers away from ashtabhuja temple and vindhyavasini temple, kali khoh temple is a cave shrine dedicated to the goddess kali. Visiting these three temples one by one forms a trikona which is said to be holy parikrama for devotees. Outside the temple is a huge tree on which people tie thread it is believed that tying a thread on this tree fulfills one's wish. Inside the temple there are two idols of the goddess kali. Goddess Kali is said to be incarnated to kill the demon Raktabeej. Although the temple is quite small but it still is an important place for Hindus.

Sita Kund: Located on the hillock of Ashtabhuja temple, Sita Kund is prominently known for its rich history. Legend has it that while returning home from the exile goddess Sita felt thirsty and thus, Lord Lakshman pierced an arrow into the ground from where the water came out of it in the form of a fountain. It is believed that drinking even a sip of water from this rocky extinguishes thirst.

article.heading: How To reach Vindhyachal
paragraph: Airways: The nearest airport to Vindhyachal is Lal Bahadur Shastri Airport in Varanasi. Frequent daily flights from major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Allahabad are available. From here one can look for outstation taxi service from Varanasi to Vindhyachal.

Car: One can self-drive or hire a cab in Vindhyachal very easily from nearby cities. The city has excellent connectivity by road. Well-maintained national highways, NH 19 and NH 35 lead from Varanasi to Vindhyachal in 1 to 2 hours. The road network is sort of good with roadside dhabas and petrol stations on the way.

Bus: There are sufficient numbers of Uttar Pradesh State Transport Buses available connecting Vindhyachal with other cities in the state. There are frequent bus services from Varanasi to Vindhyachal and Allahabad to Vindhyachal. One can suffer through many options of available buses and the exact timings of the buses can be confirmed from the UPSRTC website or contact number.

Railways: Vindhyachal is well connected to major as well as neighboring cities by Vindhyachal railway station located at the heart of Mirzapur town. Alternatively, Mirzapur junction is yet another railway station 7 km away from the main temple which can be reached via different cities of India. Both these stations are connecting Vindhyachal to all the prime regions in India through an extensive rail network. From the railway station tourists can find various taxi services or car hire to explore the city.
